t: Psalm 86
A Psalm of Supplication and Trust.
A Prayer of David.
Incline*pn Your ear, O Lord,*s and*i answer me; For*ln I am afflicted and needy.
Preserve*ln my soul, for I am a godly man; O*ln You my God, save Your servant who trusts in You.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord, For*ln to You I cry all day long.
Make*ln glad the soul of Your servant, For*ln to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
For*ln You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, And*ln abundant in lovingkindness to all who call upon You.
Give*ln ear, O Lord,*s to my prayer; And*ln give heed to the voice of my supplications!
In*ln the day of my trouble I shall call upon You, For*ln You will answer me.
There*ln is no one like You among the gods, O Lord, Nor*ln are there any works like Yours.
All*ln nations whom You have made shall come and worship before You, O Lord, And*ln they shall glorify Your name.
For*ln You are great and do wondrous deeds; You*ln alone are God.
Teach*ln me Your way, O Lord;*s I*ln will walk in Your truth; Unite*ln my heart to fear Your name.
I*ln will give thanks to You, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And*ln will glorify Your name forever.
For*ln Your lovingkindness toward me is great, And*ln You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
O*ln God, arrogant men have risen up against me, And*ln a band of violent men have sought my life, And*ln they have not set You before them.
But*ln You, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, Slow*ln to anger and abundant in lovingkindness and truth.
Turn*ln to me, and be gracious to me; Oh*ln grant Your strength to Your servant, And*ln save the son of Your handmaid.
Show*ln me a sign for good, That*ln those who hate me may see it*i and be ashamed, Because*ln You, O Lord,*s have helped me and comforted me.
